website_summaries.verdict: Water bottle bowl combo is perfect for short trips.
pros: Water can be emptied back into the bottle to avoid any waste
Convenient size for travel while still holding 20 ounces of water
Water bottle fits in most standard sized bicycle water bottle holders, or car cup holders
cons: Bottle has no insulation to keep water cold

customer_reviews.title: Wish we had found this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 dogs and have wasted a lot of water over the years in collapsible bowls. Purchased this before taking them all for a week long beach trip and now wish we had discovered it sooner! So easy to use (especially on the go), no waste, and the dogs love it! We do a lot of hiking with our pups and are thrilled to find something to make water breaks so much quicker and easier!
customer_reviews.author: T. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Mugs marked " made in China"! From Abby McCoy
customer_reviews.text: The mugs I received were marked "made in China" and were shipped from China. There was no indication they were "made in the USA" as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond J.

customer_reviews.title: To sensitive
customer_reviews.text: it works great BUT way to sensitive. if you put it in a bad it will just leak out. i solved this by putting some plastic wrap over it and tighting it with a rubber band.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves it, so that's a huge advantage. She's known to fuss about random things. I'm a wheelchair user so the convenience is awesome. I used the Velcro strap to attach it to my chair frame. It's easy to remove. The only reason I removed a star was as a warning. The seller lies on their profile. They are in fact selling out of China . If you don't mind it taking three weeks to arrive , If you don't mind that they are lying go for it. Otherwise I will pop for the extra to buy it from a Prime dealer when I replace it.
customer_reviews.author: RollinggirlTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Works real great!!
customer_reviews.text: Works real great!!! No more shared water bowls at the dog park! -My dog got a virus from our local dog park.....but if you are buying one of these then you already know how deadly the dog park communal items can be. The best part of this is that the unused water gets sucked back in the container. No Waste!! Also you can tip it and the water does not leak out.
customer_reviews.author: Gawker

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, cheap, cheap
customer_reviews.text: Be wary of the product description, because a lot of it isn't true. Made in China, shipped from China and made of cheap materials. When you squeeze the bottle, the plastic is so cheap it doesn't pop back into it's original shape, it just stays squeezed. If the bottle isn't filled all the way up with water, you're not going to get any in the bowl for your pet to drink. Big mistake.
customer_reviews.author: tacocat

customer_reviews.title: Better design now
customer_reviews.text: This is the second iteration of this doggie bowl bottle I’ve bought. In the first one, water would come out into the bowl with almost the smallest movement which resulted in water accidentally splashing out and my hands and pants getting wet. Especially if I was jogging with the dog while holding the bottle in my hand. This design is much better. It requires a deliberate squeeze to get the water out, which reduces accidents. Also, in this design you can squeeze hard to get the water on the bottom of the bottle out without popping the top off.
customer_reviews.author: Oxana

customer_reviews.title: Worst water bottle ever!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The water will go into the top but won’t go back in the bottle. That was the whole point in my purchasing this bottle. The plastic material is very cheap & can easily be punctured. There is a piece on the lid that seems like it can be used to attach an o ring isn’t large enough to be of any use whatsoever. Hands down, this is the worst water bottle I have ever purchased!! Wish I could give zero stars!
customer_reviews.author: sdk1122

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: Leaks around seal as you squeeze bottle. You can fill the bowl once, maybe twice if lucky, but after that, there is too much air in the bottle for you to squeeze it and any further water out. DO NOT BUY THIS ITEM, it is useless, doubly so for larger dogs, say 40lbs and up.
customer_reviews.author: J. K. Given

customer_reviews.title: This item is not USA Made like it claims
customer_reviews.text: This item is not USA Made like it claims. It says made in China. It also doesn't work very well. The water does not stay in the top bowl even while squeezing it. How is the dog supposed to drink if the water leaves immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Meave K.

customer_reviews.title: Yea... NO!!! Not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: It's a very small little container of water. I thought the flap that raises would seal the water into the upper section, but NO. you HAVE TO SQUEEZE the entire time your pup is drinking or ... your pup isn't drinking because it all went back into the cup part. Because it has such a wide mouth connection you cannot screw the lid onto a water bottle when the plastic on the bottom part cracks (which after just a few squeezes I'm sure it's going to.) I like the concept, just NOT the delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Evy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT idea! Love that the water flows back into the bottle
customer_reviews.text: Would love this even more, if the cup at the top of the water bottle was bigger. We have Great Danes. Although this works for them, their slobber over flowed the cup rim while they lapped up the water.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Manning

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I was directed to this seller.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these from a seller that stated in the ad that it was made in USA. However, when I received the item, it said made in China. I was directed to this seller from one of the Amazon team. (they also aided me with the return of the previous purchase) I am upset that the previous seller is able to falsely advertise their product. Their product also leaked. I am very happy with this purchase. You can tell it is better quality then the other one because it is sturdier and it doesn't leak.
customer_reviews.author: Luann Brown

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough. For the price though I thought ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough. For the price though I thought it would be a bit more substantial. Feels and operates rather flimsy. It also has a steady drip if it's on its side. It does the job. My dogs were afraid of it at first as when you squeeze it it is a bit noisy but they use it now if I fill the top before offering
customer_reviews.author: Tishtrya

customer_reviews.title: Nice concept, poor design
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product since we drive from FL to MI once a year... but there were a few flaws: 1) It was quite difficult to squeeze and kept squeezed 2) when I did squeeze it, it would leak around the sealed part 3) it did not fill the top portion enough to get an adequate drink 4) my dog was terrified of the slurping noise it made
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Walters

customer_reviews.title: One of the best doggy supplies I've purchased
customer_reviews.text: One of the best doggy supplies I've purchased. My dog loves it, and it doesn't waste any water (what she doesn't drink just gets sucked back into the bottle). It doesn't leak, and the dish isn't too bulky (it fits in a tote bag with other things easily). I don't understand the reviews of people having a hard time squeezing it for their dog, the water bottle is soft and easy to squeeze in my opinion, but still durable.
customer_reviews.author: Summer A Galey

customer_reviews.title: Good Product/Idea, My Dog Lost Interest After First Try
customer_reviews.text: This works as described. Love that it's made in the USA, that it's a 1-stop-shop (drink + container). Must continue to squeeze the bottle to prevent the contents from going back down as the dog drinks. The moment I eased up on the squeeze slightly, the contents fell back into the bottle, the useful part for me, but my Lab was no longer interested in using it. Despite panting and time that had passed in 105 degree heat, I needed to coax her to try it again, with difficulty. The 'dish' size is better suited for medium sized to smaller dogs who might not give up as easily as mine. ;)
customer_reviews.author: TruRevu

customer_reviews.title: This is basically a squirt bottle with a bowl attached.
customer_reviews.text: I saw a similar model on television and Amazon that would allow you too squeeze the bottle to allow water into the bowl and the water would o9nly drain when you want it to. This model does not have that one way valve feature and the water drains back to the bottle as soon as you stop squeezing. It takes an effort to squeeze the water into the bowl. This will also leak water if turned upside down. Spend a little more and check out the features that you need as this has just a minimal feature in that you can squeeze water into the bowl a bottle with a removeable bowl would be better.
customer_reviews.author: stst

customer_reviews.title: Good travel water bottle
customer_reviews.text: This is a good travel/hiking water bottle as you can squeeze it to fill the bowl up, then when you release it the water goes back into the bottle. By doing this, you do not have an open bowl of water sloshing around your car, but you are also not wasting water during hikes. During hikes in the past, I would fill up a travel bowl and then dump it out as my dog didn't drink it all. In hiking conditions where there is not access to water all the time, I always felt like we were wasting a lot of water. This product will definitely help and is light enough I can throw it in my dogs pack.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Meh, wish I'd ordered another brand/style
customer_reviews.text: So, on one hand my dog drinks happily out of it, so that's nice. On the other:it doesnt have a wrist strap or carry strap (bad on me for not noticing before ordering though), and it's super awkward to maintain a squeeze on the bottle so the water stays up long enough for him to drink before letting go so it drains back down. You also have to drain and let more air in before you can give them a second serving. My hyper active husky pup drinks A LOT, so this is a giant pain. Also it didn't come with any sort of receipt or paper of any kind.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Great practical product
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these for my last dog. I gave it away when he died, thinking I was not getting another. Just adopted again so bought another. It is a great way to carry water for the dog. I used to have a foldable bowl and just carried that and a plastic bottle of water but often, after filling the bowl, the dog wouldn't drink and the water was wasted. This draws the water back if the dog doesn't drink it. Can turn upside down and maybe a drop or two leaks initially then stops. Great practical product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Peden

customer_reviews.title: 😀😀😀😀
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this for anybody who travels with their pet very very good idea no spills no mess
customer_reviews.author: Serena Smith

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Where do I start. The plastic is so cheap feeling. When you squeeze it, the air doesn't go back into the bottle so it stays squeezed. It smells like a china factory The water starts falling back into the bottle even with you still squeezing it. This is literally the worst thing I've ever bought in my entire life.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Design is genius
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the easiest way to give water to your dog during a long walk or car trip. The design is brilliant. You squeeze the bottle with one hand, and dog get's water. You stop squeezing, water returns to the bottle. No spills. Unfortunately it feels somewhat flimsy, doesn't seem it has been built to last. It goes without saying, but you must of course wash the bottle thoroughly at least once a day, or it will promptly get smelly. I would say it won't be a good idea to put this in the dishwasher (nor, of course, in the microwave).
customer_reviews.author: Milton Bradman

customer_reviews.title: Great in theory - poor in execution
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to try this product. It had been on my list for about 18 months. When the company expanded its color options beyond pink, blue, and gray, I decided to give it a shot. Now, it is possible that mine is defective, but it doesn’t work. I have to squeeze with all my hand strength to get water to come up into the bowl, and then the plastic collapses and doesn’t return to form - something is clearly out of balance with the pressure in the lid/straw. It also leaks at the top when the bowl does fill. Honestly, had the product been cheaper, I wouldn’t have been so upset...
customer_reviews.author: PepeMeiAmelika

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I think of this?
customer_reviews.text: The pooch loves it. The wife loves it. I love it. We take some long trips and not so long trips with Eli the Adventure Dog and I can't begin to quantify the amount of water that has been spilled inside and outside the truck watering the dog - until now. Eli wants a drink, he knows where the water is, looks at it and if we don't notice he reaches forward and paws his dog mug, we hold it, squeeze it and he drinks until satisfied, then the remainder is sucked back into the mug. Everyone is happy. We take this on hikes as well. Every dog owner who travels with their pooch should have one.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie D

customer_reviews.title: Very good product. When the side of the container is ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. When the side of the container is squeezed, water fills the cup at the top allowing the dog to lap up water. When the squeeze is released, the excess water automatically is sucked back into the container and does not leak out even if held upside down. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars, is my hand gets tired while holding the mug level and squeezing. Perhaps a new design where the bowl area is tilted? (I have a small dog).
customer_reviews.author: stressalert

customer_reviews.title: Great! My dog loves it! USA MADE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great for the dog park, walking, etc. It works great! Plastic is lightweight but durable. A simple squeeze brings up water and sucks back down fairly quickly after you release. It can take a few small squeezes to readjust the bottle back to its normal shape. I bring this when I take my dog to the dog park - my dog loves it, as well as the other dogs there. For the people who gave this a bad review - they clearly bought the wrong item or the "knock-off" version. Nowhere is my bottle labeled "China", it is USA made in California.
customer_reviews.author: Leah C

customer_reviews.title: Company stands behind its product!😊
customer_reviews.text: Edit to my review: Contacted the company directly and they verified the seller was an authorized seller and quickly replaced the bottle with a functioning bottle! Im very happy with the customer service provided and with my new bottle!! Squeeze the bottle and no water will come up into the bowl at all! Also, the bottle continues to stay squashed unless the lid is removed. Unfortunately tried it for the first time after it was beyond the return window. Btw.. I own one of the same brand that I had purchased on a vacation and love that one. It works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Solution
customer_reviews.text: The HighWave Auto Dog Mug is the perfect solution to a problem I've had since I adopted my dog: I remembered to take a water bottle when we went on long outings, but forgot to take a bowl more often than not. This bottle has the bowl right on top, easily filled by squeezing the bottle. My dog drinks from the bowl until she's satisfied, and any water remaining is drawn back into the bottle when I stop squeezing. What could be more convenient?
customer_reviews.author: GerryTop Contributor: Classical Music

customer_reviews.title: Great idea for walks & car
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea for walks, or for carrying in the car. I need something for walks in the morning, and this works for carrying, but think I will get creative about fastening it to my belt of a strap or something. Tried it as soon a I received it on my dog, they had no problem drinking from it.
customer_reviews.author: run2it

customer_reviews.title: Best Water Bottle for Dogs
customer_reviews.text: This is the best water bottle I've ever had for my dogs. The reason: there is no water waste. Simply squeeze the bottle until the desired amount of water appears in the bowl at top. When the dog has had their fill, releasing the bottle allows the water to flow back into the bottle. I have taken this on hiking trips as well as road trips, and it works equally well. It also fits into the car's cup holder, which is nice. It's an ingenious design.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia M. Terrell

customer_reviews.title: No good....
customer_reviews.text: This is useless! I bought this to use with my clients (dogs). I take dogs on walks that I dog sit and in the summer months they can get a bit hot and thirsty. So I bought this to help them when we are on a walk. I bought one to try it out, if it worked well then I was going to buy a few more. The bottle leaked in my bag, and the dogs wanted nothing to do with it. Not even my own dog wants nothing to do with it even working with her she just wants nothing to do with it..
customer_reviews.author: Anita Jones

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing error?
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be working out really great! It’s kind of hard to squeeze but that’s not a big deal. My biggest thing (and the reason it’s only three stars) is that the first thing I noticed when I got it is that it’s kind of scratched up and there are these weird little red pieces embedded in the plastic (see pictures). If I didn’t need it right this second I would I’ve returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Dominique Cox

customer_reviews.title: No more wasted water
customer_reviews.text: You have to squeeze the water bottle for the water to get into the cap, and have to continue to squeeze, or the water goes back into the container. What we were used to before purchasing this "Mug" was a lot of wasted water when our dog drank from a water bottle, most of it was on the ground. With this container she can drink what she needed, and the rest is still there waiting for her, not on the ground but in the container. No water wasted, and a very well thought out idea.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Eva approved!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a thirsty little (rescue) senior min pin and she will drink water from a puddle! Obviously I found that both disturbing and sad so I wanted to have water ready for her at all times. She loves it!!! I keep it in the cup holder when we drive and on the night stand when we are home. She’s always thirsty when she wakes and I’m glad I can make her happy with little effort. Such a great product and price! Not to mention, say to clean!
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Squeezing is a bit tough
customer_reviews.text: While I love the concept and overall it does what it needs to do, It's a bit hard to squeeze. It does fit nicely in a car's cupholders. However, you have to squeeze it with both hands and hold it there so the top cup remains filled with water. If you let go, no more water for your pooch. So, not a deal breaker but wish it was a bit easier to squeeze with one hand. It's great for traveling. I still used it quite a bit and seems to work vs. getting out a dish and filling it.
customer_reviews.author: Erika M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great on-the-go solution for keeping your dog hydrated
customer_reviews.text: Had seen these around and thought it could be a great on-the-go solution for the beach/dog park or hiking for our dog. Needless to say, our dog took to it right away and seems to enjoy it. A little too large for me to want to carry it around on our normal everyday walk, but will be a great solution for those longer outings. In future iterations, would love to see the ability to close or lock the bottle top so that I can store it in a backpack and don't have to worry about it getting squeezed and spilling while in transit. Otherwise, I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: I wish I knew who invented this handy thing!!
customer_reviews.text: I had one just like this only another color. We left it in our boat as we were trailing it down the highway and it must have blown out because, poor, it was gone! I went to Amazon right away and ordered not just one but 2 because our son got a new puppy and wanted one of his own. I take this whenever I travel with my dog and even take it on long walks in hot weather. Its the only doggie traveling water bowl I ever want to own!!
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: A MUST-HAVE for pet travel
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had found this sooner. It is perfect while traveling with my pets. I fill it and put it in the fridge overnight so they have cold water while traveling ( for long trips, I add a couple of ice cubes). Just squeeze the bottle and hold to keep water in the upper bowl. When released, the excess water drains quickly back into the bottle - no spilling in the car! Only "con" is if your pet is really thirsty, you have to keep squeezing for a while. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: silver

customer_reviews.title: Best Dog Travel Water Bottle
customer_reviews.text: We have tried numerous methods to get our Pug to drink water on long walks, and all have failed except for this bottle. Our Pug is very picky and having the short snout, limits our options where he can get his little head next to the water without it spilling all over. The drinking portion is perfect for breeds with the short nose and the fact that the water gets sucked back into the bottle means less waste as he often will not drink when we want him to. We'll purchase another when this one breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Works wel
customer_reviews.text: This seems to work as designed, which has pros and cons. You have to get a good squeeze to get water out of it, and you have to hold on until your pet is done drinking. this could be hard for some people. On the other hand, the unused water goes back into it, saving the worry about spilling. It fits well in the cupholder of my Journey, so I can reach over and give him a drink on the go. Not fully convinced it's real durable.
customer_reviews.author: G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: For whatever reason, my dog doesn't like to drink from the collapsible bowls and carting a regular bowl around can be inconvenient. This thing is perfect for keeping him hydrated with the ease of carrying a water bottle. The first one I received did not work and I was pretty bummed since he appeared to be all about drinking from it. Back in the box it went and the seller sent a replacement at no additional charge. The new one works exactly as described and both the pup and I are happy customers.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Ingenious idea!!
customer_reviews.text: A friend with a service dog had one of these and when I saw how it works I went looking for one too. We Have 2 40 lb dogs and we go hiking a lot in summer. Cannot believe how many times we’ve used this! And people are amazed when they see it! It’s SO much easier than bringing a bowl and sharing bottled water with the dogs because whatever they don’t drink we used to have to toss out. Now we squeeze the bottle, they drink what they want and the rest goes back into the bottle. Ingenious!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristy McIvor

customer_reviews.title: Best one we’ve used over the years.
customer_reviews.text: So we love this! We’ve had dogs all our lives and travel with them by car all year long. We tried every style of travel water bottle for pets I’m sure. It fits in the drink holder perfectly, and she can easily reach it so I can just squeeze the bottle for her to get a drink and then it sucks the remainder back into the bottle. No spilling! When we leave I fill the bottle and then put ice cubes on top so she has her ice and also has a bit in reserve on the top before I have to squeeze it. Getting another one for our other vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Ladyzephyrssis

customer_reviews.title: Very poor product
customer_reviews.text: The concept is good but the quality is very poor. The seller also lied in their presentation of this product. The seller said this was made in the USA. It was sent direct from China with made in China printed on it. The chemical smell will not wash out and will not allow our dog to drink out of it. We will shop around and find a better made product. Do not waste your money on this crap and beware of anything this seller has to offer.
customer_reviews.author: maxx12

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this for our LAB
customer_reviews.text: Our 6 month old black lab goes with us almost everywhere. We were on vacation and saw someone had this for their dog. They recommended it so we purchased it on Amazon. Wherever we go people ask us about it. Our dog, Onyx, also tries to hold it herself and squeeze it to drink while we are driving (but she hasn't quite figured it out yet). It convenient, easy to use, nonbreakable and spill proof. We use it while hiking, walking in town, on our boat and while traveling in the car. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mark R Bentlage

customer_reviews.title: Very poor design.
customer_reviews.text: I don't really like this. You have to squeeze the bottle to fill the cup with water and when you let go it sucks the water back it. We had our dog at the beach and he had sand on his face. The way this is designed as he drank the sand on his face went into the cup, which then was sucked back into the bottle. Not a good design.
customer_reviews.author: Vrod-Mike

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Wow, if this is the good American made bottle I would hate to see the Chinese knockoff. It feels like the cheapest water bottle I have owned. Strap does not work well, leaks, once u squeeze it stays squeezed and wont rebound. I would not recomend this. I would have paid much more for good peoduct. Worst thing i ever purchased from Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made of cheap thin plastic
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to love this for traveling in the car with our puppy. First of all it works well. One drawback is that the water returns to the bottle if not totally drank. Making it not good for the beach or sharing. The other issue is that it is cheaply made, plastic is so thin I don’t expect it will last long, not durable. Will use it but not buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen M Galione

customer_reviews.title: Handy on the go
customer_reviews.text: I recently took my dog with me on a beach vacation and wanted something easy to have both in the car ride down and for the beach itself. This works great. You simply squeeze the bottle and water comes up into the dish and when you release the water goes back inside. Very handy, and particularly nice for the car because you only need one hand to use it and there no cap you need to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: mmallia

customer_reviews.title: Handy and convenient
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty well. I like that I don’t have to dump out the water my dog doesn’t drink like I do when I pour water into a lid for him to drink. The excess just gets sucked back in. Only thing I’m not crazy about is that you have to squeeze the bottle and hold pressure on it to keep the water in the bowl on top, but small inconvenience and not enough to make me not want to use it. I tipped it upside down to check the leaking other reviews talked about, and I didn’t have any issues with water dripping out.
customer_reviews.author: summergirl098

customer_reviews.title: bottle and bowl in one
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for long walks. No excess water to dump out and only one thing to carry - so two problems solved. Plus my pup has a tendency after a walk to guzzle water so quickly that she starts chocking (like it goes down the wrong pipe), but with me controlling the amount of water, she gets to pace herself and never chokes. My friend bought a crappy Chinese imitation for half the price, and it collapsed on itself within a week. This one is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Stavka100

customer_reviews.title: The water doesn't stay in the bowl! So its not good for people with Rheumatoid arthritis!
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from rheumatoid arthritis in my hands, so having to keep squeezing the bottle to keep the water from flowing back into the bottle DOES NOT work for me. Make sure you read all about this before you purchase! I originally thought it was defective because my girlfriend had one where the water stays in the bowl, so i ended up returning this one and went to bed bath & beyond to purchase the one she has. If its not a problem for you then its a great product to have for your pooch!
customer_reviews.author: Joanne C

customer_reviews.title: High priced
customer_reviews.text: Despite the advertisement these do leak a bit. Took a while for the dog to decide to drink from it. It does make a noise as it fills up as another reviewer stated. I am not sure there is much difference between this and the cheaper ones on tv. Plastic is very thin and as others have stated, it does stay depressed on the side for a long time even when you are not holding it, however the water does suction back into the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: quilter4

customer_reviews.title: Hard to squeeze and hold until pup drinks
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like this, I had a similar one and it work great this was hard to squeeze and you have to hold it to keep water in the bowl, as soon as you let go the water drains back into bottle. ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Green

customer_reviews.title: Broke After Four Weeks
customer_reviews.text: We use this during our daily walks with our pup. After four weeks the water started coming out of the connection between the top dish and the container instead of the bowl. I also didn't like the fact that the water went back into the bottle when you stopped squeezing the bottle. This pulled dirty water back into the bottle. I would buy something else. Avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: TeeTheCee

customer_reviews.title: Hate to Leave Negative Review, but...
customer_reviews.text: If this bottle sold for $3 it would be worth it. Company would still have still netted $1.50 profit at the least, but it sells for $15. The mid section collapes when you squeeze it and stays that way just like a disposable water bottle. About half the time I have to manipulate the sides so it pops out again. Bowl capacity is made for a small dog.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Best design for doggie water bottle yet.
customer_reviews.text: The first dog water bottle I've found that solves the problem that comes from the fact that your dog only drinks part of what you pour out for her. With this, you don't have to pour the rest on the ground and then run short before the end of your hike. Instead, the leftover water gets pulled back down into the reservoir. Very clever. I DO wish it had a little better carrying handle though. I found one of those water bottle hangers for humans and it works pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie

customer_reviews.title: Darn handy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these--one for myself and one as a gift. LOVE IT. Normally, my dog will drink bottled water as I pour it into my hand, but that wastes a whole bottle of water! This way the water just drains from the bowl back into the bottle with no waste. I have the foldable bowls, but my dog will only drink from them if he's really thirsty and then what he doesn't finish is wasted and I'm carrying around a damp fabric bowl in my pocket. I really like this for travel and long walks/hikes. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Keri

customer_reviews.title: Pros and Cons
customer_reviews.text: I like the way this mug holds enough water for a short walk on a hot day. I also like that it's easy for my dog to drink from the shallow cup. However, constant pressure must be exerted to keep the water level up. Once pressure is released, the water goes back into the mug..nice for saving water; not so nice for teasing the dog with an empty mug between sips. And if your dog is as sloppy a drinker as mine, your hands will be dripped and drooled upon as the dog drinks.
customer_reviews.author: ALH

customer_reviews.title: A must for all Dog Owners
customer_reviews.text: This drinking cup is a life saver if you have a pet. Just squeeze the bottle and the water goes into the little bowl at the top. I just keep mine in the car and remember to refill it before I travel. I will suggest for those of you that have a navigation system in your car that you put napkins or a cloth over the "mouse pad" because the water the dogs drip on the mouse pad will completely throw off your navigation system or maybe my dog is just a messy drinker!!
customer_reviews.author: Tallone

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly Designed. Works As Advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item. Well designed, easy to fill and use. My GSDs love it and can't wait to drink from it when we're at the park. You simply squeeze the bottle, the dish fills up and stays full as long as you keep squeezing. Once they dogs are done drinking, stop the squeeze and the water goes back into the bottle, that's it. While carrying, there are NO spills, no leaks, perfection. The only spills you'll experience are from when your bundle of joy is actually drinking from it, which nothing can be done about :)
customer_reviews.author: Freakonforfatty

customer_reviews.title: Cool idea, but not as practical as I'd hoped
customer_reviews.text: Holds small amount of water, only lasts about 45 min into a hike. The squeeze bottle is easy to use, I like the water flows back into the bottle after use. But it's tough to clean, I can't quite get the straw clean. It's also dofficult to store in my hiking backpack, everything else gets a little wet.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Dont like it
customer_reviews.text: I dont really like it. Had high hopes but really hate having to squeeze it and holding it squeezed for the water to stay on the top. Should have just bought one of the water bottles that folds open for the dogs to drink out of. Mistake purchasing this.
customer_reviews.author: koji

customer_reviews.title: Dogs will drink from this bottle, nice design!
customer_reviews.text: The design of this bottle is very nice. I've tried other types of pet bottles and the dog's didn't want anything to do with them. This one when I first offered it to my boxer mix she turned her head away and I thought here we go again. I offered it again and she excepted her drink. The bottle didn't look brand new. I believe it's because of the way Amazon packages their stuff. They use recycled mailing envelops even when the item purchased should be in a box. Unfortunately this happens to me all the time. The bottle I received is a genuine Highwave Auto Dog mug made in the USA. I highly recommend this bottle!
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Ingenious.
customer_reviews.text: This is the most convenient dog travel bottle I have ever come across. You literally squeeze it to dispense the water, and they will drink from the funnel like any other dog bowl/cup. It doesnt leak when flipped upside down and it also has a nice velcro strap on the middle of the bottle. If you go out with your dog/travel with them a lot, this bottle will be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Bullethammer

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Really not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Really not impressed -- poor concept, I should have known better. The worst part is the dog slobber gets sucked back in as backwash, also, bottle is so flexible, it collapses easily. A one-way valve would be much more useful and effective. My dog has no interest in drinking from it, unless the water is standing still, not being sucked back into a bottle or coming out -- there's no in between.
customer_reviews.author: tIhde

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and quick on the go!
customer_reviews.text: I've been able to use this three times since I got it two weeks ago and am in love with it! It works GREAT for my 7 lb Chihuahua, 20 lb french bulldog and 16 lb min pin, the bowl is just big enough for them. Iv'e also used it on a friends larger dogs (45 lb lab and 50 lb pointer), and while it still works, its not quite as convenient and usually messier for them since its not quite suited to their size.
customer_reviews.author: MrsAnnieBrandt

customer_reviews.title: First try and she lapped it up
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a travel water bottle that didn’t require me to pull a stopper or tip forward and back while I’m driving. This fits that bill. I will be traveling 500 miles back and forth at least quarterly so I want to make sure I can keep my princess hydrated. The only hesitation I have is the sound it makes when “sucking” the water back in. She’s not a fan, but since she will be strapped in I don’t think it will stop her from using it when she wants water.
customer_reviews.author: Mel110897

customer_reviews.title: Should have listened to my instinct and left this one alone.
customer_reviews.text: What a waste of money this was. Much smaller than it appeared in the TV ads, very cheaply made and I'm sure it won't last long. The idea is a good one, but so many improvements could be made. Plus, once you get toward the last third of the water in the bottle, it is near impossible to squeeze it to the top.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Buck

customer_reviews.title: This works great if you have a full bottle of water
customer_reviews.text: This works great if you have a full bottle of water. You squeeze the bottle and the water goes into the black bowl. But once the water is down to the half way mark, you have to unscrew the top and pour the water from the bottle and put your finger on the hole on the bottom of the black bowl to keep the water in the bowl for the dogs to drink.
customer_reviews.author: bjhansen

customer_reviews.title: Great for on the go!
customer_reviews.text: Great for on the go with your pup! Product is as pictured. Our puppy loves drinking water out of this when we’re out on walks or at the dog park. I love that the water retracts when you release the bottle so less water is wasted. Easy to clean and more convenient than silicone pop up bowls that we also have. I’m not sure what the strap around the center is for, but maybe I didn’t read the description thoroughly. I would recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Carly C.

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea, Poor Execution!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this... Feels very cheap... when you squeeze for water to come out, it comes out of the side. Have not been able to screw it tight enough to seal connection.... also when you squeeze it, the bottle gets "dented". When it fills back out, it resucks the water back into the bottle... having a hard time seeing myself using this on the road (we travel a lot). CONTEMPLATING RETURNING!
customer_reviews.author: Jake Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: I can't figure this one out!! You have to squeeze the bottle to make the water go up into the bowl so the dog can drink but as soon as you let go the water drains back into the bottle so unless you sit on the ground and squeeze the bottle and hold it with pressure, it does not work. Horrible idea!
customer_reviews.author: Cookie14

customer_reviews.title: Ingenious
customer_reviews.text: I learned of this product from a friend. It is really helpful when traveling. This last time I made the trip from Florida to Michigan it supplied water to two seperate dogs without fumbling in the car looking for the water bowl. You simply squeeze the bottle which forces the water up thru the release valve and the dogs can drink, then when they are finished you release the bottle and if there is any water left that they didn't drink, it flows back into bottle. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travelling
customer_reviews.text: Keep this in the car for our two dogs when we come back from walking on the trails. Hold a bottle of water and you simply squeeze it to fill the cup while the doggos drink. When they are done, simply stop squeezing and the water goes right back into the bottle. We bought another one to have them in each car because we like the product so much.
customer_reviews.author: CHUCKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Saves on water
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Just wish we could place it in its side without it leaking. We just use one of our cup holders on our stroller. So it’s fine. Other it’s great have have when we take out large god on long walks. He’s fussy about water and sometimes won’t drink out of public dog bowls. This has been great and because it sucks any unused water back in, we dont have to fill it up as much!
customer_reviews.author: Adriana Elson

customer_reviews.title: Funny story!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what it says it is! I had her drinking out of it, then my hand got tired and it sucked in all the water, the noise scared the dog half to death and now she won't go near it, she runs if I pick it up or she will look the other way...well that sucks. I will try it when I go hiking, I used it after a run , if she is thirsty maybe? ugh...
customer_reviews.author: lulu

customer_reviews.title: Leak proof water bottle...my dog loves this!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect solution for traveling in a car with your dog/cat/or whatever.... A water bottle that works in a car. The water goes into the drinking cup while you squeeze the bottle providing possitive pressure. When the drink is done, let go and the water drops back into the bottle. It doesn't spill and sits in the cup holder. Perect!
customer_reviews.author: Leah McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Giant Breed
customer_reviews.text: I have a super large dog and bought this for our adventures. It's handy on the go, but the only thing is that it's a little gross. You have to keep it squeezed so that the dog can drink, and whatever is left in the bowl when you release gets sucked back in. So I have to dump the slobs and water after every drink to avoid getting it in her water.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: There's a very high spill possibility with this product. Mouth is wide enough for ice. But if you turn it upside down it will spill. They need a water bottle type cap that can be pushed down to stop the water. I also saw other brands where the bowl folded down for compact carrying. But we will take it to the beach and that's probably it. Can someone please make these right?
customer_reviews.author: tch

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this
customer_reviews.text: I love this device to keep freshwater on me at all times for my service dog. I attached it to my chair with a velcro strap and I am able to squeeze the water to come up into the bowl allows him to drink and what he does not drink it goes right back down when you release the bottom parts. My only issue that I have is when I'm squeezing the bottom part to let the water come up into the bowl the lid comes unscrewed and I sometimes have spilled the water all over the place but this is an awesome product
customer_reviews.author: Alli

customer_reviews.title: So so for every day use -- but great for hiking or camping
customer_reviews.text: Good idea but I'd try a different one than this. You have to keep squeezing the bottle while dog is drinking, or all the water goes from the bowl back into the bottle when you let go. I would prefer to have the bowl stay filled without me needing to squeeze. That said, This one would be best for people who want to preserve every drop of water such as during hiking or camping. For me I just bring this on walks and car trips so maybe I'm not the ideal user.
customer_reviews.author: My2wins

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Usually my dog doesn't drink much when we're away at a show or trial. For some reason, she likes drinking out of this. It doesn't leak if turned upside down, but I put it in a solid round tall container, because if the side gets squeezed, it will put water into the top cup. I have a large breed dog, and the cup is a bit small, but larger would defeat the purpose of the portability, soooo.....
customer_reviews.author: Nancy W

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: So my sister bought me one a year back that I loved but the water once you squeezed it into the top it stayed there. It also leaked but she got it from Walmart so what can you expect. Well I broke it on accident so I ordered two more one for me and one for my mom. I’m glad to say these don’t leak and the water retracts back into the bottle to prevent spills! Definitely an improved product!
customer_reviews.author: charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item after seeing someone using it on a hot day in our local park. I walk our dog regularly and he needs water in our hot weather. This is really easy to use and doesn't leak. Also, we take long car trips and being able to pull over and not have to worry about a water source for the dog is great. This item is outstanding for dog owners.
customer_reviews.author: Aquagirl

customer_reviews.title: Picky fur baby loves this
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot for work and our fur baby comes along. He never drinks enough when we're on the road because he's picky about his bowl. He's a typical mini Aussie :) Well, turns out he loves this bottle. He is drinking more on the road now and much happier. He even begs for water when we're driving down the road. We've had no leaks at all and we carry it in his travel bag that gets thrown around from hotel to hotel. Best fur baby purchase in a long time!
customer_reviews.author: ilxtech

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for roadtrips and outdoor activities away from fresh water.
customer_reviews.text: It took a couple odd looks from our husky before she would drink, but then out was the best thing. Makes road trips and walks on the beach so much easier. Our schnauzer took to it immediately. Only difficulty is maintaining pressure for long drinks.... Especially for a larger dog who needs more and you have to squeeze stronger to release more water.
customer_reviews.author: C. T. Whaley

customer_reviews.title: Water Sucks Back In
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure I was going to like this at first, but the more we take it with us on hiking trips the more I like it. At first the suction the water going back in scared the heck out of my dog, but she's gotten used to it and slurps out out of it. I like the fact that the water goes back down into the bottle. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amy C

customer_reviews.title: Works well and much better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Works well and much better than expected! Don't leak or drip when not being squeezed. Sometimes I have to unscrew the lid to get the bottle to return to its shape after use. Suction noises kind of freaks my dogs out a little but don't deture them from drinking. The only thing that I would suggest to the manufacturer is they need to make a version of it in a small bottle size for dachshunds! The bottle is too tall for a dachshund to use unless they are being held or sitting up on a chair. If they're on the ground, they can't use it.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: seemed like very cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: This was highly leaky, seemed like very cheap plastic....you have to constantly squeeze in order to keep the reservoir filled. It also wasn't easy to squeeze and due to the cheap plastic, often squeezing it would make the reservoir not fit correctly so then it's leaking out the bottom, not to mention how much water gets everywhere while the dog is drinking. Water gets all over the place. It was a million times more inconvenient and messy then bringing a bowl for my dog and adding water from my bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Kim T

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for being out and about
customer_reviews.text: I saw this on a buzfeed article and decided to give it a try instead of having a water bottle and collapsible water bowl. This is a great dog water container! Any water that your doesn’t drink, it goes back into the water bottle so no water is wasted. It does make some noise but my dog got used to it within a use. I will not be taking anything else hiking with me anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: I carry this mug around to take to the dog park or when we are running errands. It is practically spill-free; I sometimes throw it in a bag with treats and a blanket and it does not leak. I run it through the dishwasher every day. I took one star off because you do have to apply quite a bit of pressure for the water to come out, so can be a bit tough on the human in case of arthritis or other issues with your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence L.

customer_reviews.title: Water everywhere for our fur babies
customer_reviews.text: I had order one before this about 1year ago and it had a leak around the band. I did order another because it is a excellent product for dogs. We walk our dog at least twice a day and she does need water after our walk because it is very hot her in Florida. Great product. Love it. Would recommend this for all dog lovers. Thanks again
customer_reviews.author: Patti Moore

customer_reviews.title: Love this for Bentley
customer_reviews.text: This is SO MUCH better than the Gulpy we used to use. Squeeze and water comes out, Bentley drinks, and then let go and any water left gets sucked right back in. It's an elegant design that never spills water and holds plenty for an entire day of activities. I have three.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. RobTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great product!  Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! I can keep it in my truck without worrying about making a mess and I don't waste a bunch of water if my dogs aren't that thirsty. My dogs drank out of it the first time I used it, too. I was a little worried about them being weirded out by it since it's not like bowl they're used to drinking out of. The only thing that would make this better is if it had a carrying handle or strap attached. There is a velcro strap around the center, but it doesn't really seem to do anything.
customer_reviews.author: StephanieAlana

customer_reviews.title: A great idea but ...
customer_reviews.text: Holds water & is convenient but it is hard to keep the water in the bowl top as it easily slips back into the container. The design could be improved with a twist top. In a pinch and because my dog is small, she can drink a small amount while I hold it. It is hard for me to squeeze to fill and maintain the water in the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: flgulflover

customer_reviews.title: A definite PLUS
customer_reviews.text: This water bottle is a great addition for your dogs out on a walk or for a long car ride. We use this for both of our dogs for walks and car rides. It's super easy to reach behind the seat, squeeze the bottle, and give the dogs a taste without a big spill all over the back seat. When you release the squeeze, the remaining water goes back down into the bottle. It's not too bulky to take on the walks with the dogs. Super easy to get them to drink out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Pro ShopperTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: nice design for car cup holders..works great... seems durable.
customer_reviews.text: have to admit my dog is still not drinking a ton out of it... not scared of it, but a little timid still....but it is winter time and maybe she isn't quite as thirsty... but she has sipped out of it...I think as she gets more and more used to it she will readily drink out of it. That being said the design and functionality are great... I used to carry more of a canteen type water bowl. was messy and bulky... this sits nicely in cup holder and if think she is thirsty I just squeeze it...and Voila' ...after she is done it slips back down into bottle so no spills.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

product_meta.title: Highwave AutoDogMug
feature_bullets: THIS IS THE ONLY AUTHENTIC LISTING FOR THE HIGHWAVE AUTODOGMUG - any other listing is considered a counterfeit and only ours can be guaranteed to be BPA Free as well as food and dishwasher safe.
BEWARE OF IMPOSTERS -Any sellers listing the AutoDogMug are NOT authentic Highwave AutoDogMugs.

EASY TO USE AND MESS-FREE -Our patented one-handed hydration system is simple to use: just squeeze the bottle and the specially designed valve delivers water to the bowl. Release your squeeze, and the water returns to the virtually leak-free bottle.

DESIGNED FOR CONVENIENCE -The 20 ounce bottle easily fits into any standard car cup holder. It features an adjustable hook-and-loop strap that can be secured around your wrist or attached to your backpack or belt, making it easy to carry on the go.

FILL WITH FRESH WATER FROM A TRUSTED SOURCE -Having fresh, clean water for your dog can help prevent health issues related to drinking from public water bowls and puddles which can contain disease-bearing bacteria, parasites or unknown toxins.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
